so amazing. great story and great actors. great show for my early 20s generation.  i love this show. can't wait for season 2!!
Anyone in their 20s can relate to this show. It's real, funny, and honest. I've watched the season multiple times.

Characters are relatable and the writing is hilarious. I definitely wasn't expecting it to be as explicit as it was but if you can get past that or if that doesn't bother you then it is one of the best shows out there.

Okay so I started watching this all the way to the end of season 1. At first I could totally relate to Hannah and then somewhere in the midst of empowering women I lost my feelings for the show. While the concept of this show is good I felt there was a lack of well DIVERSITY! They're all young, WHITE, fresh out of college and have they're parents money available when they need it. Sure it's realistic... for like 2% of the population. I would have liked it better if there was a variety, like wealthy, middle-class and poor racially and morally diverse women. Also I'm perfectly fine with sexuality but the butt sex was just freaking bizzare!!!
This is a rating for the premier program only: It's intriguing enough to give it more of a try, although it does not seem to be of the same quality as Tudors, Boardwalk Empire, or The Wire.

I've never been one of those people who get in to shows, but this show has changed my life. Lena Dunham is a genious. It's funny, sad, gross and everything in between. You'll feel so bad for her, then fall in love with her. Adam is a weirdo and most girls will admit, we've had a boyfriend just like him. Highly recommended!!!

Girls... what can I say, we all know women like the ones depicted in this show.  Lena Dunham's acerbic portrayal of millenial women in NYC hits close to home, but that doesn't make her perspective any less important or FUNNY!

I'm a 27 years old (28 in 3 weeks) African-American male. I'm obviously not the target demographic of the show. However, for some reason, I like these girly shows (and before you ask, I'm straight). I was a fan of Gossip Girl until it became stupid towards the end. Initially, I wasn't planning on watching this series, but I saw about a million advertisements for Girls in the NYC Subway. I finally decided to succumb to peer pressure. I bought the season 1 DVD from Target and watched the entire season in 3 days.

I can definitely see why some people dislike this show, but most of the episodes are entertaining. Watching this show requires some suspension of disbelief. The protagonist of the series is Hannah, a self-conscious and slightly overweight (but definitely not fat) girl in her mid-20's. Although she is book smart, she is completely dense. She once made a joke about date rape during a job interview. She quit another job she had after her ~60 year old boss refused to have sex with her. She reminds me of a female version of George Constanza. Hannah's frenemy is Marnie (sp?), an attractive but insecure girl. Hannah and Marnie have their cat fights and usually make up in the next episode.

Jessa is a hot British girl. She's an eccentric, pot-smoking party girl, like a raunchier Phoebe Buffay. Shoshanna (sp?) is the innocent virgin (SPOILER: she loses her virginity in the season finale).

What I didn't like about this series is that all of the male characters are douches. Adam, Hannah's borderline abusive boyfriend, is the dumb jock type. He rarely has a shirt on. He reminds me of Kelso from That 70's Show. Elijah is a recurring guest star. He's Hannah's ex-boyfriend who turned gay. He is the gay stereotype. Charlie is Marnie's boyfriend. They split up and 2 weeks later, he met someone else. Jessa got hit on by the father of the kids she babysits.

This show is a caricature of life in New York City. I don't think it's meant for people to take seriously. No one can be as dense as Hannah. Furthermore, in real life, I find it hard to believe that a guy like Adam would be attracted to an average looking girl like Hannah. The funniest episode of the series was when they went to the party in Bushwick. The show started off realistic- Hannah had to survive in the city after being cut off by her parents. Then, the show became less realistic as it progressed. SPOILER: in the season finale, Jessa marries a guy she knew for 2 weeks.

There isn't a single character who I like. I found myself laughing AT Hannah instead of cheering for her. Nevertheless, the show is funny. Many people have complained about the lack of minorities on the show. I don't have an issue with this. There are blacks and Asians on the show, but they appear mostly as extras. In New York City, there are all-white cliques, but that doesn't necessarily mean that they're racist or exclude minorities. I'd rather the show reflect reality than to have a token black character (Donald Glover is going to appear in season 2).
They said it was new, still wrapped, and would get here before Christmas. It was, it was, and it did.  Thanks
"Girls" is a show I definitely want to see more of. It's similar to Sex and the City just more down to earth and real. Love it!

I bought this day one as a blind buy. I guess it was an impulse purchase. I just do not like it. I felt the main character was just not likeable. She has sex with the same ugly guy when it is good for him. So he ties her up and does her in the butt. I am not shy to sex on television but I hate this show. Snotty bitches complaining about things they should be grateful for. Get off you crusty lazy ass and quit expecting Mommy and Daddy to support you. Ugh, I wish I had seen before I bought. I felt like I had been butt assaulted after watching this.

Oh, to describe how bad it sucked. Well, your imagination can't imagine how badly this sucked. I don't want to say the word "girls," now. Or watch these people have sex. It is not funny. My boyfriend said that it had no nudity, even though it totally did, it was just so absolutely bizarre. I read that it had "awkward sex" and that made me want to watch it.  That was the best part, but still not good, just bizarre. and not in a good way. we did not laugh or get into it or LIKE the CHARACTERS!!!!!! the characters sucked, they were not well-defined or believable or well-acted. It is the antithesis of Sex in the City which is such a big, well-acted show. It just is not, at all FUNNY. or clever. or anything!!!!! at all. I had some weird frown on my face, the whole time, like I had eaten a semi-sour pickle. This is not an expression that I enjoyed! Also, I was kind of psyched about the dad character. I think he was the quirky yuppie from Newhart and his part was very disappointing. It was like watching a train wreck, except it wasn't a train wreck. It was like watching an empty train track with no landscape and a girl would say and do some pretty disgusting, yet boring things, and you would be so glad that you didn't pay 19.99 to be there, and you would drive away. P.S., the pretty girl was too pretty and unbelievable. They all were unbelievable.
I love this show and the quality is fantastic. I can only imagine that the HD version is even better however the regular was just fine.
This show was sad and poorly written. Reflections of a very screwed up generation. I won't be watching additional seasons - overrated.

real, honest, charming, great acting, relatable characters (great script). all-around great cast. Girls faces issues head-on that the young-adult generation struggles with today and portrays it in a humorous, honest light. Heartily recommend to girls, boys, women, and men alike.
Silly stories used to link one sexual act to the next. Characters with no qualities other than an excess of hormones; one dimensional.
Girls is a refreshing and realistic take on post college life for modern day 20 somethings. The writings is witty and intelligent. I strongly recommend anyone to watch this series!!!

It's an HBO show so you know right off the back you are getting a quality product since HBO,Showtime & AMC are the 3 stations putting out real TV these days. Lena Dunham may rub some people the wrong way but she is like many girls from my generation. As a male i wasn't sure when it premiered if i'd like this show or not but the cast is great & there is some seriously funny humor. The main male character Adam is hilarious & guys will enjoy this as much as girls. Hopefully season 2 lives up to the potential that season 1 showed
This show is the best thing to ever happen to television... Bravo!!!!!!!!!!!!! I can't wait for season 2 great job
This was a purchase that I didn't even question. The series is amazing - the writing, directing and acting is awesome. Great show for men and women. Lena is great!

I love the show wish it was on every night. I'am in my 50's and when my 22 year old daughter came home from College I got her hooked. We sat up and watched the complete first season. So looking forward to Jan 2013 season 2.
I have never laughed so hard or been able to relate to any show but this one. Thank you Lena dunham!
The preview of Girls made the show sound very interesting.  If I find the time to watch it I'm going to purchase the series.
Like Louie for mid-20 somethings, full of harsh honesty and, at times, enough times, laugh out loud funny.  I want to add an extra star for Chris Eigeman's cameo.
Love this show so much, nothing else like it on TV. Just wish I didn't have to wait until the next season to watch more!

A Quick Retort to the Haters:

As a film-maker and a 20 something male, there is little to criticize about this show. Though many have indeed taken a stab at it, their indignation is usually directed toward the ontology of the characters in the show. Many of these critics shout their contempt for the "rich white girl" status of the characters, yet forget to define their concept of wealth or what it means to be spoiled. These individuals compare their own existential existence to those of fictional characters. Which only proves one thing, and this is that Girls is pretty damn good. Because if you pull away the girls wealth, race and location your still left with 4 crazy girls. Not women, girls. And that is truly why the show is so dang good. Because being in your early 20s is a ride of pure narcissism and ignorance. It's a time of mistakes and growth, denial and pride. And this show illustrates that so incredibly well.

 Why You Should Watch Girls:

Prior to my rant above, I wanted to discuss why the show is worth buying, renting, or pirating. Like I said above, the show show is what its like to be in your 20s. Though the philosophy or experience might not include everyones ideology, I find it to have many truths. People in their 20s are selfish, ignorante and prideful. Sex, friendship and perennial relationshops are consistently defined and redefined. Such realizations we hold dear and ultimately true, only to be tweaked a year or so later. Girls illustrates this nature of man. The writing and cinematography is reminiscent of older Woody Allen films, yet done through the eyes of a women. Lena does this not through a radicle feminist agenda, but from an hernest and humain place. Both sexes are equal, and its about damn time. So pick it up and watch. If you don't like it give it to a young girl. After all the show is called girls, because thats what many 20 somethings are, children.
I am totally bummed, I thought this was the season but was only a clip. I got some popcorn, got all comfy on the couch. Psych. Boo Amazon. Boo. I completely missed where it says 'runtime 2min'. :(

Have I gone crazy watching this show? I would have to admit that it seems to have affected my sanity.  I absolutely loathe this series.  If you want to watch stories about rich whiny white girls deal with obstacles such as working for a living then this is your show.  I watched the pilot and it actually felt painful to get through the whole thing.  Some people love it, but then it only has an HBO sized audience which is tiny in comparison to a show on Network television.  Girls is definitely a love it or hate it show.  Since I have lived, worked and supported myself in New York City for the past 11 years, and I worked my way through college I simply cannot relate to these four annoying cliches - The exotic foreigner, the hyper idealistic girl from Long Island, the pretty girl, and the self-deprecating nerd.  The show also takes place in Brooklyn, where white people happen to be the minority only taking up about 30% of the population, yet in Dunham's universe anyone important is white.  It is Sex in the City minus the campy fun and designer labels.  If you are over 25 I wouldn't bother, you will simply lose your mind watching this drivel.
don't waste your time, couldn't make it to episode 2.
Awful, just awful! Total waste of time.
The only character I liked was her mom.  Then again I am in no way shape or form the target demographic for this show.

Although the first couple of episodes didn't thrill me I continued (I'm not one to give up easy), but it was WELL worth it.  The second, third, and fourth seasons were my fav.  I loved the characters and the funny story-lines!
bad acting and just a bunch of girls doing college life and going from guy to guy
very painful to watch...yuck
Useless, would give 0 stars if i could

I started watching this because someone recommended I watch as they compared the show to Sex and the City. I am not an avid watcher of Sex and the City, but needed something to keep me entertained over the winter holiday. This plots of this show are pretty much the cliche of what I keep hearing about millennials, or that generation with the title of millennial. It's not a bad show, but maybe the ideas are a little overplayed. I was able to binge-watch two seasons before the WiFi died and will definitely check out the other three when I am in an area of the world where Internet isn't blocked, so I find the show worth the watch. While the girls in the show don't really stand out all that much, I did like the male characters. They kind of made the girls a little more tolerable.
